text: we were planning to buy a domain for our (franklin made gh-pages deployed) webpage, so that the url will not have the .<http://github.io|github.io> . The workflow is not 100% clear to me, my understanding is that we buy a domain (e.g. from <http://namecheap.com|namecheap.com> ) and then the URL can simply be customized from github, i.e. the page is still hosted on github. Any devil in the details that I am missing?

elements.text: we were planning to buy a domain for our (franklin made gh-pages deployed) webpage, so that the url will not have the .
. The workflow is not 100% clear to me, my understanding is that we buy a domain (e.g. from
) and then the URL can simply be customized from github, i.e. the page is still hosted on github. Any devil in the details that I am missing?

text:
it's super simple you need

1. to add a `CNAME` file with the address like this one: <https://github.com/tlienart/Franklin.jl/blob/gh-pages/CNAME>
(put this in your base folder next to `config.md` and `index.md`
  2.  in the repo settings, just specify that you deploy on a specific address (just enter the same address than in CNAME under "custom domain" in the repo settings

that's basically it

Note: ah and you need to remove the `prepath` of your `config.md` if it's there (as now the base URL doesn't need a postfix)
